item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 22, 2025 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple pulls data protection tool after UK government security row (940 points | 703 comments)
2. Richard Feynman's blackboard at the time of his death (1988) (193 points | 105 comments)
3. Google Titans Model Explained: The Future of Memory-Driven AI Architectures (64 points | 11 comments)
4. Suckless.org: software that sucks less (173 points | 85 comments)
5. Yocto, RockPi and SBOMs: Building modern embedded Linux images (84 points | 35 comments)

7. The Ren'Py Visual Novel Engine (103 points | 35 comments)
8. Math Academy, part 1: My eigenvector embarassment (14 points | 6 comments)
9. 20 years working on the same software product (228 points | 76 comments)
10. Reality has a surprising amount of detail (2017) (238 points | 120 comments)
11. Sparse Voxels Rasterization: Real-Time High-Fidelity Radiance Field Rendering (44 points | 8 comments)

13. DeepDive in everything of Llama3: revealing detailed insights and implementation (109 points | 4 comments)

15. Every .gov Domain (292 points | 235 comments)

22. Train Your Own O1 Preview Model Within $450 (375 points | 57 comments)

24. Cot: The Rust web framework for lazy developers (63 points | 31 comments)
25. NASA rover discovers liquid water 'ripples' carved into Mars rock (55 points | 17 comments)
26. Ancient switch to soft food gave us overbite–the ability to pronounce 'f's,'v' (130 points | 94 comments)
27. The CRPG Renaissance, Part 3: TSR Is Dead (61 points | 26 comments)
28. We are the builders (412 points | 164 comments)
29. Why Ruby on Rails still matters (213 points | 161 comments)
30. Fly To Podman: a script that will help you to migrate from Docker (143 points | 80 comments)
